clubs.name: Nacional
clubs.description: One of the oldest and most successful clubs in Uruguay with a rich international history.

clubs.name: Peñarol
clubs.description: Historic rival of Nacional, known worldwide for intense rivalries and passionate supporters.

clubs.name: Defensor Sporting
clubs.description: Recognized for strong youth development and consistent top-flight presence.

clubs.name: Danubio
clubs.description: A club famous for producing talented players who succeed in Europe.

clubs.name: Liverpool FC (URU)
clubs.description: Modern era success story with recent titles and strong performances.

clubs.name: River Plate (URU)
clubs.description: Known for entertaining football and its traditional neighborhood identity.

clubs.name: Montevideo Wanderers
clubs.description: Historic club with a loyal fan base and frequent international appearances.

clubs.name: Cerro
clubs.description: Traditional team from the Cerro neighborhood with strong local identity.

clubs.name: Juventud de Las Piedras
clubs.description: A traditional team from Las Piedras, known for strong community identity and consistent performances in the Uruguayan leagues.

clubs.name: Plaza Colonia
clubs.description: Representative of the interior teams, with a remarkable league title in recent years.

clubs.name: Cerro Largo
clubs.description: Young club from the interior with growing influence in the league.

clubs.name: Boston River
clubs.description: Club that recently reached international competitions, punching above its weight.

clubs.name: Progreso
clubs.description: Working-class club with a historic league title in the late 1980s.

clubs.name: Montevideo City Torque
clubs.description: A modern and ambitious club known for its professional structure, player development, and its connection to the City Football Group.

clubs.name: Miramar Misiones
clubs.description: Historic Montevideo club formed from the merger of Miramar and Misiones, known for its traditional neighborhood identity and developing young talent.

clubs.name: Racing Club de Montevideo
clubs.description: Historic Montevideo club known as La Escuelita, recognized for talent development and its passionate neighborhood fanbase.
